page.title: 03Housing and services
page.content: From having no main services at all a generation ago, all the houses now have electricity and mains water. Along the main road the houses are connected to the gas main, but down the lanes away from the A48 people use bottled gas or none. Waste water runs to septic tanks to decompose and purify before seeping away through the earth. The school shares a septic tank with the next-door house which used to be the headmaster's house but is now privately owned. We have a weekly refuse collection from the Forest of Dean depot. The telephone is universally available. The only public buildings in the area are our primary school and a village hall; churches, chapels and two more village halls are in adjoining blocks.
